column4: sorry was disconnected... no idea if anyone replied to me, i repeat then my question:

Hi! I have installed recently Lucid on a desktop, its running smoothly, but I noticed that SOME files that I try to delete from Lucid are bypassing the trash. Trash bypassing (it actually tries to send the file to trash but it prints an error msg like: cant send to trash, permanently delete only) seems to apply to any file located on another partition than where Lucid is (in my system case...

...it also means that the problematic files that were made from older ubuntu/mint distributions). Files which have been created under Lucid are normally going to trash, no pbs here. Any idea, how to fix it so that any file to be deleted would go  through the trash bin?
